Functions

void * i386_memset (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 the 386 glibc implementation of memset

void * i586_memset (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 the 586 glibc implementation of memset

void * i686_memset (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 the 686 glibc implementation of memset, alignment preamble is borked

void * i686_memset_fix (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 the 686 glibc implementation of memset, w/ a fix to the alignment preamble

void * lx_memset_zan (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization replacing the three conditional jumps of the 686 implementation with a rep; stosb for the unaligned portion

void * lx_memset_simp (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization with no alignment correction

void * lx_memset_hyb (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization which combines the "short" and "aligned" tests into a cmovz and a single conditional jump

void * lx_memset_hyb_BA (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 same as lx_memset_hyb(), but with quadword alignment logic instead dword alignment logic

void * lx_memset_mmx (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization using a 32 byte unroll loop and movq (slow)

void * lx_memset_mmx64 (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization using a 64 byte unroll loop and movq w/ dword alignment logic (which is a bad idea)

void * lx_memset_mmx64simp (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization using a 64 byte unroll loop and movq but w/ quadword alignment logic

void * lx_memset_mmx64_BA (void *dst, int c, size_t n)
 lx optimization using a 64 byte unroll loop and movq w/ no alignment logic (which is fastest if the dest is quadword aligned)

void * lx_memset_mmx64_h2 (void *dst, int c, size_t n)

Detailed Description

This file defines the functions types and names for the memset performance optimization test. Memset performance test.
